moves.1. e4: This will be my third annotation. I am, once again, playing the white pieces. I start again with e4.
moves.2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3: Except for the part where I get a tempo. :) Devoloping knight AND attacking the queen.
moves.5... Qe6 6. O-O Nf6 7. Bb5 Ng4 8. Bxc6+: I would not have chosen to use the queen in this situation.
moves.9... Qh6 10. d3 Qh5 11. h3: Checkmate will not come my way! At least not yet.
moves.16... Bd6 17. Ne4 Bh2+: I thought this was a very unusual attack he played.
moves.18. Kh1 f5 19. Nec5 Bc6 20. b7: Had to happen eventually, and he can't take it with the bishop. :)
moves.20... Rd8 21. Na5 Bxg2+: ?? What is his method here? Get rid of all your pieces?
moves.22. Kxg2 e5 23. Nc6 f4 24. Nxd8: Why did he let go of the rook?
moves.25... e4 26. Qxe4+: But he didn't see one against him!
moves.26... Ne5: I would have blocked with the queen. You might scare off the white queen and get the black queen into a better position, or you can trade them.
moves.27. b8=Q: Had to happen at some time or another.
moves.31... Kg7 32. Nge6+: And now, checkmate cannot be avoided.
moves.32... Kg8 33. Qxf8#: And that, ladies and gentlemen, is how you should not play a game of chess, especially after your opponent has promoted a pawn so that they have 2 queens.

gameName: One of my oddest games ever
